resources.string: An unexpected error occurred. Please get in touch if this issue persists.

An unexpected error occurred:

%1$s

Please get in touch if this issue persists.
It is not possible to check in here any more.
When attempting to establish a secure connection to the luca servers, we found untrusted certificates.\n\nPlease try switching your network and make sure that you\'re using the latest app version.
The process could not be executed. Please connect to the internet and try again.
You are currently unable to check in. Check your connection and try again. Please contact us if your check-in still does not work.
Informs you if a health department has accessed check-ins related to you.
Informs you about events that happened within luca.
You\'re currently checked in. Please remember to check out when leaving the location.
You\'re currently hosting a private meeting. Please end it as soon as your guests left.
A health department has requested your contact data.
You\'ve left the location and have been checked out automatically.
luca helps you encrypt and securely submit your contact data. With luca, you don\'t have to worry about your data when visiting events, restaurants, cafés or bars anymore.
You can view our privacy policy under this link.
Please enter your contact data in the next step.\n\nYour data will be encrypted. Only a health department can decrypt it during contact tracing.
Please provide your name, phone number and address.
"By changing your name, imported documents will be deleted. Apply all changes?"
Please enter your first name to continue.
Please enter your last name to continue.
Please enter your phone number to continue.
Please enter your street to continue.
Please enter your house number to continue.
Please enter your zip code to continue.
Please enter your city to continue.
Hosts must collect the addresses of their guests. Therefore, in order to use luca, it\'s mandatory to enter your address.
Please provide a correct mobile or landline number. This number will be used for verification. You can choose if you want to provide an email address.
Hosts usually have to collect the addresses of their guests. Therefore, in order to use luca, it\'s mandatory to provide your address.
Please enter your contact data in the next step.\n\nYour data will be encrypted. Only health departments can decrypt it.

You can now share your encrypted contact data by presenting your QR code or by scanning a code from a place that uses luca.\n\nChecking in is possible at places that use luca or private meetings with other luca App users.
Hooray! A lot has happened at luca
Swipe right to see what\'s new.\n\nNo time right now? You can also find all the information in the "Account" tab.
You can find all info and even more explanation screens in the news section of the "Account" tab.\n\nPS: Don\'t forget to check out!
Add children\nYou can now use luca for your children as well.
Important notifications\nYou will receive any notifications or warnings here.
Add your children to check them in with you. You can even import documents for them, but make sure to input full and correct information.
Our different warning levels can inform you in more detail, when you were checked in somewhere at the same time as an infected person. Affected events are marked in your history.
When you press on \"Check-in\", luca now directly starts on the camera. Just activate the camera once and you\'re good to go. Access your personal QR code by clicking on the button below it.

You can now access your history via the icon in the top right corner of the \"Check-in\" tab.\n\nAs always, your data cannot be viewed until you generate your TAN and share it with the health department.
It is not possible to send an email from this device because no email account is connected.

Dear luca support,
The following problem occurred while using the app:

Please describe here as precisely as possible your problem and where it occurs. It would be very helpful if you could also attach a screenshot or screen capture of the error message or problem.

%1$s
Scan the QR code of a place that uses luca or a private meeting to check yourself in.
This is your QR code. For check-in, have it scanned at a place that uses luca.
Tap here to enable the camera
luca needs access to your camera so that you can scan QR codes of documents, at locations or private meetings. Only the QR code data will be processed and no other data will be stored.

The QR code you scanned is not a valid check-in link.

QR code data:
%1$s

Checking into this location is optional. If you still want to help with contact tracing and be alerted in case of risk, you can check in voluntarily and even anonymously. Your contact information will not be shared with the health department if you check in anonymously.
Optionally share contact information with the health department
luca locations may have a 2G/3G entry requirement. When you share your status, locations will be informed whether you meet their entry requirement, but will not see your 2G/3G proof.

I hereby give my consent in accordance with Art. 9 (2) a) in combination with Art. 6 (1) 1 a) DSGVO to process the status of my stored COVID test, recovery or vaccination document (tested negative, recovered or vaccinated). At check-in, my luca app checks whether my imported document matches the location\'s entry requirement. My luca app displays whether I fulfill the entry requirement of the location I am checked into. My document or the data and information it contains will not be stored or transmitted outside of my luca app.

You currently have no documents in your \"My luca\" tab and therefore cannot share your 2G/3G status. Manually show your 2G/3G document as soon as you are checked in. If you want to automatically share your 2G/3G status for the next check-in, add your document in the \"My luca\" tab.
Let your guests scan the QR code to check into your meeting.

Private meetings are meant for small gatherings with friends and family. They are used as reminders and won\'t be shared with health authorities - that\'s why they display the full names of you and your guests.

Do you want to start a private meeting now?

When friends and family check into your private meeting, their first and last names will be shown in your app. They will also see your first and last name in their app.

Private meetings are used as reminders and won't be shared with health authorities.
Do you really want to end this meeting?

If you continue, you will check into a private meeting. This will submit your first and last name.\n\nPrivate meetings serve as reminders for small gatherings with friends and family. Therefore, hosts see the first and last names of their guests (and guests see the first and last names of their hosts). This data is displayed in your history, but cannot be shared with health authorities.
Please slide the arrow to the right
Hey, you\'re scanning the QR code of a document and not of a luca location. If you want to add a document, click \"CONTINUE\".
You want to check in at %1$s?
You are already checked in. Do you want to change the location?
Select the children who are currently checked in with you. This selection won\'t be saved and must be made each time you check in.
You can add children (up to 14 years) to your app to import their documents and check them in with you. The information will not be shared with the health department, it is for your convenience only.
Please provide your child\'s full name. Documents can only be added if the names match.
When you delete a child, all the related documents are also deleted.
A required permission has not been granted.
You just checked in a moment ago. Please don\'t check out before actually leaving the venue.
You seem to still be at the venue. Please don\'t check out before actually leaving the venue.
We can\'t verify your current location. Please make sure that location services are turned on.
Unable to check you out right now. Please make sure that you are connected to the internet.

Activating this feature will check you out automatically as soon as you leave the location that you\'re checked in at.\n\nluca needs to have access to your location for this to work. When activated, automatic check-out is set by default, but you can deactivate it during your next check-in.

This automatic checkout feature uses geofencing. If supported by a luca-location, you can check out automatically using you phone\'s location service, even when the app is closed. This is only done with your consent under art. 6 (1) 1 a) GDPR (more: data privacy - app). However, you can still check out manually at any time.
For the automatic check-out feature, luca needs to have access to your location while you\'re checked in, even when the app is closed. Please select the following option: %1$s
Please activate your location services to use this feature.
Automatic check-out is not possible anymore because your location services have been disabled.
Your history collects all your activities from the last %1$d days. You don\'t have any entries during this period at the moment.
Your history gathers all of your check-ins from the last %1$d days. You can decide how many days you want to share with the health department. Define the number of days:

Would you like to share your contact data and the last %1$d days of your history with the health department? This is only done with your voluntary consent in accordance with art. 9 (2) a) GDPR (more: data privacy - app).
If you give this TAN to a health department, they can decrypt your history and inform luca places:\n\n%1$s
All entries have been removed from this device.
You released your contact data and the last %1$d days of your history for the health authorities.
Do you really want to clear your history?
Past entries won\'t be displayed in your app anymore, but will stay in the system for up to 28 days and will be shared with the health authorities if you share your data.
No data requests from health departments in the last 14 days.

One or more health departments have requested your contact data.

While contact tracing, one or more health departments decrypted your contact data. They are currently evaluating whether there is a risk and will contact you if necessary.

Please act responsibly.
You have a new data request.
One or more health departments have requested your contact data.
While contact tracing, one or more health departments decrypted your contact data. They are currently evaluating whether there is a risk and will contact you if necessary.\n\nPlease act responsibly.
You have a new data request.
You were checked into a luca place at the same time as a person who tested positive for coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2).
Please act responsibly, reduce your contacts and contact your local health department – especially, if you experience any symptoms. The health department also advises doing a rapid test.
Attention! There is a potential risk of infection.

You were checked into a luca place at the same time as a person who tested positive for coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2). A health department has assessed the situation at this location and deems you at an elevated risk of infection.
Attention! There is an elevated risk of infection.

You were checked into a luca place for which multiple health departments have decrypted data. This could potentially mean that there were multiple people present who tested positive for coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2). Therefore there is a risk that this is an aggregation of infections.

Please act responsibly, reduce your contacts and contact your local health department – especially, if you experience any symptoms. You should also get tested, if possible.\n\nThis notification has been triggered automatically by luca.
Attention! You were checked into a luca location for which multiple health departments have decrypted data.
This is your personal space, where you can add documents to make your check-in easier.\n\nVia the calendar icon in the upper right corner you can book test appointments.
The time you set in your phone doesn\'t match the current time.
Scan the QR code of your document to add it to the app.

I hereby declare my consent in accordance with Art. 9 (2) a) in conjunction with Art. 6 (1) 1 a) GDPR to the processing of my data during the import of my COVID test, recovery or vaccination certificate in the luca app. The data included in the document can be matched to my first and last name in the luca app. I also allow the storage of a pseudonymized identifier on the luca server. This is solely to prevent misuse, so that a document cannot be used by different people. The document’s individual identifier is automatically deleted from the luca system after 72 hours of storage.
The document could not be imported
It was not possible to validate that this document belongs to you. Please check if your name is entered correctly in the app.
It was not possible to validate that this document belongs to you or your children. Please check if the names are entered correctly in the app.
It was not possible to validate the signature of this document. The document provider may not be supported by luca yet.
Documents can only be added for your children if they are under the age of 14.
This document\'s issue date is set in the future. You can only add documents that are valid at the moment.
Unfortunately, the document cannot be imported because it already expired.

luca helps you to check in easily. Since only negative test results are relevant for checking in, you can only add negative results at the moment. You can only add a positive result if it is a PCR test older than 14 days.
The QR code could not be scanned and the data could not be processed. This could be because this QR code is not compatible with luca.
The data didn\'t contain a valid document from a provider that we support.\n\nHowever, it seems to point to a website where you may get more details.
This scanner is only for adding documents. If you want to check in at a location, switch to the \"Check-In\" tab (bottom left of the navigation bar). There you will find the \"Self Check-In\" button.
Hey, you\'re scanning the QR code of a luca location and not of a document. Click \"CONTINUE\" to check in.
The document could not be added because the dates of birth do not match.
Do you really want to delete the document?
To verify your phone number we will send a TAN to the number you provided in the next step. Please make sure this number is correct:\n\n%1$s
You will receive a call with a message containing the TAN that is needed to verify your phone number in the next step. Please make sure the phone is nearby and the number is correct:\n\n%1$s
We\'ve sent you a message with a TAN. Please enter the TAN here to verify your phone number.
The TAN you entered was incorrect. Please try again.

It can take a few minutes for the TAN to arrive. Please wait a moment before you request another TAN. If nothing happens after a few minutes, please check if you\'ve provided the correct number and try again.
You have recently requested a TAN. Please wait a moment. If nothing happens, you can try again in:\n%1$s
This network\'s TAN request limit has been reached. Please try to switch your network or try again at a later time.
The luca service is currently unavailable, please try again later.
The luca app that you are currently using is outdated, please install the latest version.
You are currently using the Android app version %1$s (release %2$d).\n\nThe source code can be found on GitLab using the commit hash %3$s.
Take me to the code repository

luca is open source. It\'s important to us that everyone can comprehend how the luca system works and that it\'s possible to give independent feedback. If you want to take a closer look, you\'ll find the code repository on GitLab.
Do you really want to delete your account?

If you delete your account, you will not be able to check in or access your history.

In accordance with the Corona/COVID-19 infection control regulations, all encrypted check-in data will be deleted after 4 weeks.

Once your account is deleted, you can still be notified by a health department up to 4 weeks after your last check-in.

Your data collected and processed for contact tracing is stored locally in your app and encrypted on the luca server. The luca server is hosted by Deutsche Telekom AG. Certification of this can be found at: https://open-telekom-cloud.com/de/sicherheit/datenschutz-compliance. Furthermore, Bundesdruckerei Gruppe GmbH provides other IT infrastructure services that enable secure transmission of your data to health authorities. Our subcontractor neXenio GmbH provides software development, software maintenance and software operation services. Neither we nor neXenio GmbH can decrypt or clearly view your data at any time. During registration we verify your phone number by sending an automated SMS. For this purpose, your phone number will be sent to our SMS service provider. The current recipients can be found in our current privacy policy: https://www.luca-app.de/app-privacy-policy/\n\nOnly you can view, edit and delete your data within your app. If you have already checked in at a luca location and a health department has requested it from the operator, the dual-encrypted data will be decrypted by the operator and then by the health department. Only the health department can access the decrypted data while contact tracing and view your data. With the exception of the health authorities (legal basis Art. 6 para. 1 lit. c DSGVO in conjunction with the respective state ordinance to combat COVID-19 infections, Infection Protection Act), we do not pass on your data to third parties.

All information about the processing, purposes, legal bases and deletion periods can be found in our privacy policy: https://www.luca–app.de/app–privacy–policy/. Your data will not be transferred to third countries. Automated decision–making and profiling according to Art. 22 DSGVO are not carried out by us or the contractors of the luca system.

If you would like to receive information about your data, which we have received as clear data through your own contact (e.g. support requests), please contact our Privacy Team at privacy@culture4life.de. Please share any other information that would help us identify you and research your related data with us. If you have been in contact with us via social media, information such as your e–mail address or the pseudonym you use in those social media channels are important in order to provide you with your requested information.

In accordance with Art. 77 DSGVO, you have the right to complain to the supervisory authority if you believe that your personal data is not processed lawfully. The address of the supervisory authority responsible for our company is: Berliner Beauftragte für Datenschutz und Informationsfreiheit, Friedrichstr. 219, 10969 Berlin, Tel.: 030/13889–0, e-mail: mailbox@datenschutz-berlin.de.

Within your luca app, you have the option to store a test result, vaccination or recovery certificate. Your data stored and transferred to the luca app will not leave your smartphone. Your data is only stored locally in your app on your smartphone. A transmission to our servers, to the operator or to the health authorities does not take place. Your data will not be passed on to third parties.\n\nOnly information necessary for identity matching (first and last name, date of birth, vaccination date, issuer and vaccine) is displayed in the app. Other data may be included in the test or ID document, but will not be displayed to you. All data contained in the QR code is listed here. To prevent misuse, so that the same document cannot be stored by different people in the luca app, a pseudonymized identifier is created by your app and transmitted to the luca system. Only the identifier is stored in the luca system. We cannot assign it to you.
Deletion takes place 28 days after the deletion of the account or annually at the end of each year
Deletion takes place via deletion in the app or as soon as validity is exceeded
QR-code data (contains your data in encoded form)
Marketing Authorization Holder - if no MAH present, then manufacturer "ma"
ISO8601 complete date: Date of Vaccination "dt"
ISO 8601 complete date of first positive NAA test result "fr"
ISO 8601 complete date: Certificate Valid From "df"
ISO 8601 complete date: Certificate Valid Until "du"

Every day a new daily key is created by one of the health departments that use luca. The health departments need this key to decrypt check-in data. Here you can see which health department created the key that\'s currently in use.
We are updating our terms of use and privacy policy.
Tap "AGREE" to accept the updated terms of use and privacy policy.
Quisque hendrerit facilisis ultricies, fusce a convallis.
Curabitur tincidunt in lectus at scelerisque. Nunc arcu lectus, lobortis ut aliquam ac, accumsan nec risus. Quisque hendrerit facilisis ultricies. Fusce a convallis lacus.
